      • isValidEmailAddress

        public static boolean isValidEmailAddress(java.lang.String emailAddress)
        Validates an email address. Adapted from http://www.regular-expressions.info/email.html
        Parameters:
        emailAddress - string representing email address
        Returns:
        whether or not the email address passes the validation check

      • isValidPhoneNumber

        public static boolean isValidPhoneNumber(java.lang.String phoneNumber)
        Performs basic validation on input string. A phone number is considered valid if it contains only numbers, whitespace, and the following special characters +.-()
        Returns:
        a boolean representing whether or not the phone number passes validation

      • isValidCustomAttributeKey

        public static boolean isValidCustomAttributeKey(java.lang.String key)
        Checks whether an input key is a valid custom attribute key or not.

        Custom attribute keys must be non-null, may not not be a reserved key and may not not start with a reserved prefix.

        Reserved keys: "first_name", "last_name", "email", "gender", "dob", "country", "home_city", "email_subscribe", "phone", "facebook", "twitter", "image_url", "push_subscribe"

        Reserved prefixes: "appboy"

        Parameters:
        key - The identifier of the custom attribute
        Returns:
        true iff key is a valid custom attribute key.

      • isBlacklistedCustomAttributeKey

        public static boolean isBlacklistedCustomAttributeKey(java.lang.String key,

        public static java.lang.String[] ensureCustomAttributeArrayValues(java.lang.String[] values)
        Parameters:
        values -
        Returns:

      • ensureAppboyFieldLength

        public static java.lang.String ensureAppboyFieldLength(java.lang.String field)
        Parameters:
        field -
        Returns:
        If the field is longer than the maximum allowed length, return a truncated field. Else return the field.
